abstract: D.C. United is considering whether to sign Dwayne De Rosario, 33, to a long-term contract as one of the team's designated players.
snippet: D.C. United is considering whether to sign Dwayne De Rosario, 33, to a long-term contract as one of the team's designated players.
lead_paragraph: Based exclusively on the 2011 season, D.C. United judged Dwayne De Rosario correctly, while the two teams who traded him - Toronto in April, and the Red Bulls in June - badly underestimated him. De Rosario finished tied for No. 1 in M.L.S. goals with 16, almost leading a D.C. United push that fell short of the playoffs. Thirteen of those goals, along with 7 assists, came in his 17 matches with D.C. United.

headline.main: Decision Time for D.C. United and De Rosario
